1970.description: Hot dry summer produced powerful tannic wines with deep color and firm structure. A classic vintage that needed decades to soften.

1971.description: Warm vintage with some late-season rain. Elegant and medium-bodied wines, particularly successful on the Right Bank with ripe Merlot.

1972.description: Cold wet growing season with insufficient ripeness. Thin acidic wines lacking fruit and concentration.

1973.description: Large crop diluted by September rains. Light pleasant wines for early drinking that lacked staying power.

1974.description: Wet autumn ruined a potentially good harvest. Green tannic wines with little charm or fruit.

1975.description: Hot dry summer followed by harvest rains created powerful but austere tannic wines. Right Bank fared best with riper Merlot.

1976.description: Exceptionally hot drought-stricken summer produced ripe but sometimes baked wines. Early-maturing with soft tannins.

1977.description: Dismal cold wet summer produced underripe angular wines. One of the worst vintages of the decade.

1978.description: Late-ripening vintage saved by an Indian summer in October. Elegant wines with fine tannins and good balance.

1979.description: Large crop of even healthy fruit. Correct well-balanced wines that matured gracefully if without exceptional depth.

1980.description: Cold summer and persistent rain made for a thin difficult vintage. Light wines lacking substance.

1981.description: Warm dry summer though yields were reduced by poor flowering. Elegant structured wines with charm, outshone by 1982.

1982.description: Legendary hot vintage with early harvest. Opulent rich concentrated wines with masses of ripe fruit and sweet tannins. A paradigm-shifting year.

1983.description: Hot summer with selective botrytis in Margaux appellation. Rich powerful wines in northern Medoc, more variable on the Right Bank.

1984.description: Cold damp growing season failed to ripen Cabernet Sauvignon. Lean green wines, slightly better on the Merlot-dominant Right Bank.

1985.description: Warm generous vintage with healthy fruit and smooth tannins. Charming seductive wines with lovely balance, approachable young.

1986.description: Classic Cabernet year with a hot dry summer producing powerful structured wines. Left Bank excelled with massive tannic wines built for aging.

1987.description: Rain at harvest diluted what could have been a decent crop. Medium-bodied wines for early consumption.

1988.description: Classic structured vintage from a dry warm growing season. Firm tannic wines with excellent aging potential, especially in the Medoc.

1989.description: Scorching hot summer with drought stress produced deeply concentrated hedonistic wines. Early-ripening Merlot excelled on the Right Bank.

1990.description: Another exceptionally hot year with more balanced conditions than 1989. Generous powerful wines with great depth and fine tannins across all appellations.

1991.description: Devastating April frost wiped out much of the crop. Survivors were thin and green from a cool wet summer.

1992.description: Persistent rain during harvest rotted much of the crop. Dilute light wines lacking concentration and structure.

1993.description: September rains spoiled a promising season. Medium-bodied wines with some charm but lacking depth. Right Bank slightly better.

1994.description: Hot summer followed by September rain before harvest. Good Cabernet-based wines on well-drained Left Bank soils, more variable elsewhere.

1995.description: Excellent vintage from hot dry conditions. Powerful structured wines with ripe tannins and great balance. Strong across all appellations.

1996.description: Late-ripening Cabernet benefited from a warm dry October. Firm classical wines with great structure and acidity, superb in the Medoc.

1997.description: Early harvest from a warm spring and hot August, but September rains diluted the crop. Pleasant easy-drinking wines without concentration.

1998.description: Wet conditions favored the Right Bank where Merlot thrived on clay soils. Outstanding in Pomerol and Saint-Emilion, more mixed in the Medoc.

1999.description: Generous crop of ripe fruit though August rains caused some dilution. Charming medium-bodied wines for mid-term drinking.

2000.description: Millennial vintage with perfect late-season weather. Rich opulent wines with silky tannins and great depth across all appellations.

2001.description: Excellent vintage overshadowed by 2000. Cool conditions produced elegant structured wines with fine acidity, especially on the Right Bank.

2002.description: Late-season rains disrupted harvest. Best wines come from early-picked Merlot on the Right Bank. Left Bank more inconsistent.

2003.description: Record-breaking heatwave produced atypical powerful wines with high alcohol and low acidity. Some excellent, some overblown and baked.

2004.description: Classic vintage with good structure and moderate concentration. Cabernet Sauvignon performed well on well-drained Medoc gravel.

2005.description: Textbook vintage with warm dry conditions throughout. Deeply concentrated balanced wines with ripe firm tannins. Exceptional across the board.

2006.description: Warm summer but cooler September. Solid well-structured wines with good fruit but not the opulence of 2005.

2007.description: Wet growing season with rain at harvest. Light fruity wines for early drinking. Some decent Right Bank wines from careful producers.

2008.description: Cool vintage rescued by a brilliant October. Classical firm wines with bright acidity and moderate weight. Best on the Left Bank.

2009.description: Gloriously warm vintage with ideal conditions throughout. Rich generous wines with velvet tannins and extraordinary depth.

2010.description: Dry growing season with cool nights preserved acidity in deeply concentrated wines. Powerful structured wines rivaling 2009 but with more classical profile.

2011.description: Spring drought followed by wet cool summer. Uneven ripening produced variable wines. Best in Pomerol and Pessac-Leognan.

2012.description: Late-season warmth rescued a challenging start. Ripe Merlot on the Right Bank outperformed the Cabernet-dominant Left Bank.

2013.description: Cold wet summer with September rains. Lean wines with green tannins. Only the most rigorous estates produced acceptable wines.

2014.description: Indian summer in September and October rescued the vintage. Elegant balanced wines, particularly strong in the Medoc and Pessac-Leognan.

2015.description: Warm dry vintage with ideal ripening conditions. Generous opulent wines with ripe tannins and great richness across all appellations.

2016.description: Dry summer with perfectly timed September rain refreshed the vines. Cabernet Sauvignon excelled, producing powerful structured wines with extraordinary precision.

2017.description: Devastating April frost reduced crop significantly. Surviving vines produced decent concentrated wines but quantity was dramatically low.

2018.description: Hot dry summer with late-season rain providing relief. Rich powerful wines with ripe fruit and polished tannins. Merlot especially successful.

2019.description: Warm vintage with drought stress moderated by timely rains. Elegant balanced wines with freshness and finesse, combining power with refinement.

2020.description: Warm early-ripening vintage produced during pandemic lockdowns. Concentrated structured wines with excellent balance and aging potential.

2021.description: Cool wet spring with mildew pressure followed by a moderate summer. Classical lighter-styled wines with good acidity but less concentration.

2022.description: Extreme drought and heat produced deeply concentrated powerful wines. Careful water management was key. Rich dark wines with firm structure.

2023.description: Variable conditions with a wet spring followed by a warm dry summer. Balanced wines with good freshness, particularly successful in Pomerol and Saint-Emilion.

1970.description: Abundant crop diluted by rain. Light fruity wines without great depth or aging potential.

1971.description: Small crop of concentrated wines from a hot dry summer. Rich Pinot Noir with good structure and depth.

1972.description: Cold wet growing season produced thin acidic wines. Poor ripeness made for a difficult vintage.

1973.description: Generous yields from a warm vintage. Pleasant fruity wines that lacked concentration and aged quickly.

1974.description: Rain at harvest damaged the crop. Lean dilute wines with little character.

1975.description: Rot from persistent rain devastated the harvest. Thin weedy wines that were largely unsuccessful.

1976.description: Scorching summer and drought produced ripe concentrated wines, though some lacked acidity and dried out quickly.

1977.description: Terrible cold wet vintage with no ripeness. Undrinkable thin wines from most producers.

1978.description: Exceptional late-ripening vintage saved by a warm September and October. Beautifully balanced wines with depth and elegance.

1979.description: Good vintage with a large healthy crop. Attractive fruity wines with moderate concentration and good balance.

1980.description: Cool vintage producing light but pleasant wines with decent acidity. Better than the difficult 1970s vintages.

1981.description: Modest vintage of correct wines without excitement. Medium-bodied with moderate fruit and structure.

1982.description: Large crop from a hot summer. Ripe wines with soft tannins that matured quickly. Overproduction diluted many wines.

1983.description: Hail damage in some communes but warm conditions ripened the surviving fruit. Rich sometimes rustic wines, variable quality.

1984.description: Cold summer and fall rains produced thin underripe wines. One of the weakest vintages of the 1980s.

1985.description: Perfect growing conditions with warm dry weather throughout. Silky elegant wines with beautiful fruit purity and fine tannins.

1986.description: Cool damp vintage producing lean structured wines. Decent acidity but lacking flesh and generosity.

1987.description: Good vintage overshadowed by 1985 and 1988. Charming medium-weight wines with pleasant fruit and moderate structure.

1988.description: Classic vintage with excellent structure and acidity from a long cool growing season. Firm wines that aged beautifully.

1989.description: Warm generous vintage with early harvest. Ripe open wines with soft tannins and forward fruit.

1990.description: Outstanding vintage combining richness with structure. Deep concentrated wines with superb balance from an ideal growing season.

1991.description: Frost reduced the crop but surviving grapes ripened well in a warm autumn. Small lots of concentrated wine from top growers.

1992.description: September rains diluted the harvest. Light watery wines from most producers, though a few made decent short-term wines.

1993.description: Excellent vintage with superb color and concentration. Warm September after a cool start yielded rich structured wines with great aging potential.

1994.description: Harvest rains spoiled a promising vintage. Dilute wines with some rot-affected batches. Careful selection was essential.

1995.description: Warm summer with timely rains. Rich round wines with sweet fruit and polished tannins. Very consistent vintage.

1996.description: Brilliant vintage with extraordinary acidity and structure from cool nights. Precise mineral wines with stunning purity and longevity.

1997.description: Early-ripening warm vintage. Pleasant forward wines with soft fruit but less structure and depth than 1996.

1998.description: Uneven vintage with variable quality depending on harvest timing. Some attractive wines with good fruit but many diluted by rain.

1999.description: Generous yields of ripe healthy fruit from a warm vintage. Seductive voluptuous wines with great depth and silky tannins.

2000.description: Warm vintage with some rain at harvest. Attractive forward wines for medium-term aging. Mildew pressure required vigilant viticulture.

2001.description: Cool classic vintage producing elegant restrained wines with bright acidity. Not flashy but refined and age-worthy.

2002.description: Late-season warmth concentrated the fruit after a difficult start. Powerful structured wines with great density and impressive aging potential.

2003.description: Extreme heatwave produced atypical rich heavy wines. High alcohol and low acidity made for unusual Burgundy that divided opinion.

2004.description: Large crop of pleasant fruity wines from a cool summer. Charming if lightweight, best consumed in the medium term.

2005.description: Exceptional vintage with perfect ripeness and concentration. Rich powerful wines with great structure and intensity yet retaining Burgundian elegance.

2006.description: Warm August after a mixed summer. Attractive wines with good fruit and moderate weight, if without the depth of 2005.

2007.description: Variable vintage with rain at harvest. Lighter-styled fruity wines that matured quickly. Best from top domaines with strict selection.

2008.description: Cool vintage with good acidity producing classic lean wines with red fruit character. Improved considerably with bottle age.

2009.description: Warm generous vintage producing rich ripe wines with great depth and plush tannins. Forward and appealing from the start.

2010.description: Cool growing season with late harvest yielded intensely concentrated wines with vibrant acidity and remarkable precision. Age-worthy and complex.

2011.description: Variable year with hail damage in some villages. Lighter elegant wines with good fruit where unaffected by storms.

2012.description: Small crop from hail and poor flowering but concentrated healthy fruit. Rich focused wines with good structure from reduced yields.

2013.description: Difficult vintage with late harvest and rain. Lighter wines with high acidity. Best showed charm and purity despite the challenges.

2014.description: Warm dry September rescued a cool wet summer. Elegant bright wines with red fruit purity and fine tannins.

2015.description: Warm dry vintage with perfectly ripe fruit. Rich generous wines with beautiful depth and approachable tannins. Superb across the Cote d'Or.

2016.description: Frost damage reduced crops dramatically but survivors produced concentrated elegant wines with fine acidity and mineral character.

2017.description: Early harvest from a warm growing season. Ripe charming wines with good fruit and moderate structure, approachable young.

2018.description: Hot dry summer produced rich concentrated wines with dark fruit character. Power balanced by good acidity in the best examples.

2019.description: Outstanding vintage with perfect balance of richness and freshness. Precise elegant wines with extraordinary purity and depth.

2020.description: Warm early vintage producing deeply colored concentrated wines with remarkable energy and fine-grained tannins. Small crop but high quality.

2021.description: Cool classic vintage after spring frosts reduced crop. Elegant perfumed wines with bright acidity and finesse, recalling old-school Burgundy.

2022.description: Drought year with early harvest. Concentrated wines with firm tannins and dark fruit, though some lacked the classic Burgundian delicacy.

2023.description: Moderate vintage with a warm dry summer after a damp spring. Balanced wines with good freshness and attractive red fruit.

1970.description: Average vintage with decent acidity but lacking richness. Simple wines for early consumption.

1971.description: Warm vintage producing rich white Burgundy with good weight and moderate acidity.

1972.description: Cool year with high acidity and lean character. Thin wines without much fruit expression.

1973.description: Large crop of pleasant everyday wines. Agreeable but lacking concentration.

1974.description: Difficult year with rain at harvest. Dilute wines with little interest.

1975.description: Modest wines with decent structure but limited fruit richness.

1976.description: Hot drought year with rich heavy wines. Many lacked the acidity for long aging.

1977.description: Very weak vintage of thin underripe wines. Almost entirely forgettable.

1978.description: Excellent vintage with ripe fruit balanced by firm acidity. Rich complex wines that aged gracefully.

1979.description: Good crop of clean fresh wines with attractive fruit and moderate depth.

1980.description: Cool lean vintage producing simple wines with high acidity and little flesh.

1981.description: Decent vintage with balanced wines showing moderate richness and clean flavors.

1982.description: Warm large crop of ripe generous whites. Pleasant and forward but many lacked staying power.

1983.description: Rich powerful wines from a warm vintage. Some of the best had excellent concentration and balance.

1984.description: Cool vintage of lean crisp wines. Decent acidity but not much generosity.

1985.description: Warm vintage with excellent ripe fruit and good structure. Generous complex wines from top sites.

1986.description: Classic vintage with outstanding acidity and minerality. Steely structured wines that developed beautifully with age.

1987.description: Modest vintage of pleasant light wines. Charming but without depth or complexity.

1988.description: Firm structured wines with excellent acidity and moderate richness. Classical age-worthy white Burgundy.

1989.description: Opulent rich vintage from a hot summer. Generous wines with tropical fruit and creamy texture.

1990.description: Another warm year producing rich wines. Slightly less acidity than 1989 but great depth and concentration.

1991.description: Frost-affected vintage with reduced yields. Simple wines without great distinction.

1992.description: Excellent vintage with ripe healthy fruit and great balance. Rich wines with good acidity that proved very age-worthy.

1993.description: Cool wet vintage producing lean wines with decent acidity. Better than the reds this year.

1994.description: Rain at harvest but careful sorting produced decent wines. Rich but sometimes lacking precision.

1995.description: Warm vintage producing rich opulent wines with good depth. Ripe fruit balanced by firm acidity.

1996.description: Outstanding vintage with brilliant acidity and mineral intensity. Precise focused wines with exceptional aging potential.

1997.description: Forward early-maturing wines from a warm season. Pleasant but premature oxidation affected many bottles.

1998.description: Mixed vintage with some pleasant wines though many showed early signs of oxidation. Inconsistent quality.

1999.description: Generous warm vintage producing ripe plush wines. Good concentration though many suffered premature oxidation later.

2000.description: Rich warm year producing forward generous wines with moderate acidity. Premature oxidation issues affected some bottles.

2001.description: Classical vintage with bright acidity and mineral character. Restrained elegant wines, though oxidation problems persisted.

2002.description: Superb vintage with rich fruit and great acidity. Powerful concentrated wines from ideal harvest conditions.

2003.description: Extreme heat produced heavy wines with low acidity. Atypical white Burgundy that aged poorly in most cases.

2004.description: Good vintage with clean fruit and decent acidity. Attractive balanced wines for medium-term consumption.

2005.description: Rich concentrated vintage from a warm dry year. Powerful wines that needed time to show their complexity.

2006.description: Good vintage with attractive fruit and moderate weight. Clean well-made wines for medium-term drinking.

2007.description: Ripe generous wines from an early harvest. Good richness and approachable young, though some lacked acidity.

2008.description: Classical cool-climate vintage with racy acidity and mineral drive. Lean but precise wines that improved with age.

2009.description: Warm vintage producing generous ripe wines. Forward and appealing with good fruit but moderate aging potential.

2010.description: Exceptional vintage with brilliant acidity and concentration. Intense mineral wines with outstanding structure and longevity.

2011.description: Warm early vintage with decent fruit. Pleasant wines that matured relatively quickly.

2012.description: Small crop of concentrated wines after poor flowering. Good richness and depth from naturally low yields.

2013.description: Cool vintage with excellent acidity and purity. Lean precise wines with great mineral character and aging potential.

2014.description: Outstanding vintage with ripe fruit and razor-sharp acidity. Generous complex wines with remarkable precision and depth.

2015.description: Warm vintage with ripe generous fruit. Rich wines that sometimes lacked the acidity of the best vintages.

2016.description: Frost-affected vintage with tiny yields but exceptional concentration. Intense mineral wines from a cool growing season.

2017.description: Excellent vintage with ripe fruit and great balance. Rich generous wines with good acidity and depth.

2018.description: Hot dry summer produced rich powerful wines. Best examples retained freshness through careful harvest timing.

2019.description: Warm vintage with balancing acidity. Generous wines with depth and minerality from well-managed vineyards.

2020.description: Early harvest of concentrated fruit with excellent natural acidity. Precise intense wines with great aging potential.

2021.description: Cool classic vintage with high acidity and lean profile. Mineral-driven wines recalling the great 2014s.

2022.description: Drought conditions concentrated the fruit. Rich wines with surprisingly good acidity from early-morning coolness.

2023.description: Balanced vintage with good fruit and fresh acidity. Attractive wines showing classic Burgundian minerality.

1970.description: Modest vintage with cool growing season. Most producers relied on non-vintage blends.

1971.description: Warm summer produced ripe fruit with decent acidity. Some vintage declarations.

1972.description: Cold and wet throughout. No vintage declarations from major houses.

1973.description: Large harvest but dilute. Few vintage wines of note.

1974.description: Cool summer with late ripening. Thin and acidic wines.

1975.description: Exceptional vintage with warm dry summer. Rich powerful wines with great aging potential. Widely declared.

1976.description: Scorching hot summer produced very ripe grapes. Full-bodied wines, though some lacked the classic Champagne acidity.

1977.description: Dismal weather throughout. No significant vintage declarations.

1978.description: Late-ripening year saved by warm September. Elegant wines with good acidity.

1979.description: Large crop of very good quality. Balanced wines with finesse, widely declared vintage.

1980.description: Cold wet year. Very few vintage declarations.

1981.description: Small crop due to frost but good quality fruit. Concentrated wines from those who harvested well.

1982.description: Hot summer produced very ripe generous wines. Rich and opulent style, widely declared.

1983.description: Warm but uneven summer. Some rot required careful selection. Best wines are surprisingly good.

1984.description: Cool rainy summer. Very few vintage declarations.

1985.description: Perfect balance of warmth and freshness. Elegant, refined wines with superb aging potential. Classic vintage.

1986.description: Good growing season though not as exceptional as 1985. Firm structured wines.

1987.description: Difficult vintage with late season rain. Few declarations.

1988.description: Classic vintage with ideal growing conditions. High acidity balanced by ripe fruit. Superb structure for long aging.

1989.description: Warm ripe vintage producing generous fruit-forward wines. Softer than 1988 but immediately appealing.

1990.description: Outstanding vintage with warm summer and ideal harvest conditions. Rich powerful wines with complexity and depth.

1991.description: April frost devastated vineyards. Small difficult crop.

1992.description: Uneven growing season. Some decent wines but generally unremarkable.

1993.description: Surprisingly good after a rainy start. Fresh elegant wines from careful producers.

1994.description: Rain at harvest diluted quality. Few vintage declarations.

1995.description: Hot dry summer followed by perfectly timed harvest rains. Powerful concentrated wines with wonderful complexity.

1996.description: The benchmark Champagne vintage. Blazing acidity with extraordinary concentration and minerality. Will age for decades.

1997.description: Warm early harvest. Forward drinking wines with ripe fruit but less structure than 1996.

1998.description: Uneven season with good Chardonnay. Some strong Blanc de Blancs produced.

1999.description: Very large crop with good quality. Generous fruity wines, less structured than 1996 but very appealing.

2000.description: Mixed season redeemed by warm September. Good quality broadly declared vintage.

2001.description: Warm but uneven. Some decent wines but inconsistent quality across the region.

2002.description: Magnificent vintage. Perfect Indian summer conditions produced wines of extraordinary depth, finesse and minerality.

2003.description: Record-breaking heat wave. Atypical rich wines lacking classic Champagne freshness. Unusual but interesting.

2004.description: Large crop of very consistent quality. Classic Champagne profile with bright acidity and elegant fruit.

2005.description: Dry warm summer but October rains complicated harvest. Best producers made very good wines.

2006.description: Uneven season with a warm July/August and cool September. Good Pinot Noir year, widely declared.

2007.description: Challenging vintage with rain and uneven ripening. Few major declarations.

2008.description: Exceptional vintage. Cool conditions preserved acidity while late sunshine brought beautiful ripeness. Precise mineral wines built for decades.

2009.description: Warm generous vintage. Fruit-forward accessible wines with good early appeal.

2010.description: Cool vintage with high acidity. Lean structured wines that should develop well.

2011.description: Early harvest after warm spring. Light but pleasant wines.

2012.description: Classic vintage with ideal harvest conditions after a challenging growing season. Beautifully balanced wines with precision.

2013.description: Late harvest with excellent concentration. Fresh vivid wines with great aging potential.

2014.description: Good Chardonnay vintage. Blanc de Blancs particularly successful.

2015.description: Warm dry summer produced rich concentrated wines. Outstanding Pinot Noir. Power combined with freshness.

2016.description: Dramatic spring frost reduced yields significantly. Surviving grapes were concentrated and intense.

2017.description: April frost severely reduced production. Quality was good where vines survived.

2018.description: Warm generous vintage with large crop. Rich opulent wines with ripe fruit character.

2019.description: Hot summer but cool nights preserved acidity. Exceptional balance of power and freshness. Widely declared.

2020.description: Early warm harvest produced ripe wines. Sunny growing season with good concentration.

2021.description: Frost and rain made this a challenging year. Small production but decent quality from the best sites.

2022.description: Very hot dry summer. Record early harvest produced powerful concentrated wines with surprising freshness.

2023.description: Variable conditions with rain and warmth. Good quality overall, particularly for Chardonnay.

1970.description: Warm vintage producing structured Syrah with good depth.

1971.description: Ripe vintage with concentrated fruit. Hermitage excelled.

1972.description: Cool wet vintage. Dilute wines lacking concentration.

1973.description: Generous vintage with soft approachable wines.

1974.description: Cool growing season produced lean angular wines.

1975.description: Rainy harvest reduced quality. Some decent Hermitage produced.

1976.description: Scorching summer produced big powerful wines. Very ripe tannins.

1977.description: Difficult vintage with persistent rain. Thin underripe wines.

1978.description: Legendary vintage. Perfect conditions produced monumental Syrah with extraordinary depth, complexity, and longevity.

1979.description: Very good vintage overshadowed by 1978. Balanced elegant wines.

1980.description: Cool vintage with moderate quality. Light but pleasant wines.

1981.description: Warm summer but rain at harvest. Uneven quality.

1982.description: Hot vintage producing rich opulent wines. Forward and generous.

1983.description: Outstanding vintage with perfect ripeness and structure. Powerful long-lived wines.

1984.description: Cold wet vintage. Light wines without much character.

1985.description: Superb vintage with warm balanced growing season. Elegant powerful wines.

1986.description: Mixed vintage with some rain. Decent wines from best producers.

1987.description: Difficult vintage. Light and early-drinking wines.

1988.description: Superb conditions produced classic Northern Rhone Syrah. Firm structured wines with pepper and dark fruit.

1989.description: Very warm vintage. Rich powerful wines with ripe generous fruit.

1990.description: Magnificent vintage. Intense concentrated wines with layers of complexity. One of the great years.

1991.description: Exceptional vintage often overshadowed by 1990. Structured precise wines with great purity of fruit.

1992.description: Rainy vintage with dilute wines. Few highlights.

1993.description: Decent vintage with good fruit but some dilution from late rains.

1994.description: Good vintage with moderate ripeness. Elegant restrained style.

1995.description: Warm generous vintage with very good concentration and structure.

1996.description: Uneven growing season. Fresh structured wines from best sites.

1997.description: Early warm harvest. Forward approachable wines with ripe sweet fruit.

1998.description: Very good vintage with excellent structure and depth. Classic Northern Rhone character.

1999.description: Outstanding vintage. Rich concentrated wines with exceptional balance and complexity.

2000.description: Good vintage overshadowed by 1999. Balanced mid-weight wines.

2001.description: Excellent vintage with superb structure. Dark intense wines from Hermitage and Cote-Rotie.

2002.description: Rain-affected harvest. Light wines without great depth.

2003.description: Extreme heat wave vintage. Powerful concentrated wines, though some lack freshness. Best from north-facing slopes.

2004.description: Classic cool-climate vintage. Fresh elegant wines with good acidity.

2005.description: Superb vintage with perfectly ripe Syrah. Dense structured wines with dark fruit and spice complexity.

2006.description: Very good vintage with warm summer. Generous wines with fine tannins.

2007.description: Fresh vintage with excellent Cote-Rotie. Elegant perfumed wines.

2008.description: Cool uneven vintage. Some good wines from careful producers.

2009.description: Warm generous vintage producing rich powerful wines. Deep color, concentrated fruit, silky tannins.

2010.description: Exceptional vintage. Perfect growing conditions produced intense structured wines of extraordinary complexity. One for the ages.

2011.description: Early harvest after warm spring. Forward drinking wines with good concentration.

2012.description: Small crop of concentrated wines. Dark intense Syrah with mineral backbone.

2013.description: Cool late-ripening vintage. Elegant lighter-bodied wines.

2014.description: Warm summer saved by cool finish. Balanced fragrant wines.

2015.description: Magnificent vintage. Hot dry summer but cool nights preserved freshness. Powerful concentrated wines with extraordinary depth.

2016.description: Classic vintage after tricky growing season. Precise structured wines with peppery Syrah character.

2017.description: Superb vintage with warm balanced conditions. Generous wines with great purity of fruit and silky tannins.

2018.description: Hot vintage producing rich powerful wines. Deep color with ripe dark fruit character.

2019.description: Outstanding vintage combining power with elegance. Concentrated wines with exceptional freshness and complexity.

2020.description: Warm dry vintage producing intense concentrated wines. Great structure and aging potential.

2021.description: Cooler vintage with fresher wines. Good acidity and elegance, lighter style.

2022.description: Very hot dry summer. Concentrated wines with ripe fruit, some lacking freshness.

2023.description: Variable conditions. Good quality from best producers with balanced wines.

1970.description: Warm year with decent Grenache-based blends.

1971.description: Good conditions for GSM blends. Ripe fruit.

1976.description: Hot dry vintage. Powerful concentrated wines.

1978.description: Great vintage. Warm dry conditions produced profound Chateauneuf-du-Pape.

1981.description: Good warm year with balanced wines.

1983.description: Strong vintage with good structure and ripeness.

1985.description: Very good vintage. Balanced ripe wines.

1986.description: Good year, overshadowed by neighbors.

1987.description: Light vintage, early drinking.

1988.description: Strong structured vintage. Classic Chateauneuf character.

1989.description: Hot vintage producing powerful concentrated wines. Exceptional ripeness.

1990.description: Magnificent vintage. Rich powerful wines with complexity and depth. One of the greats.

1991.description: Frost damage and rain. Modest quality.

1992.description: Rain-affected harvest. Light wines.

1993.description: Decent vintage, some good Grenache.

1994.description: Good vintage with solid structure.

1995.description: Excellent concentrated vintage. Rich powerful wines.

1996.description: Cooler year, lighter style wines.

1997.description: Warm early harvest. Forward wines.

1998.description: Outstanding vintage. Classic rich wines with great structure.

1999.description: Very good vintage. Concentrated warm wines.

2000.description: Superb vintage with perfect Grenache. Rich complex wines.

2001.description: Outstanding vintage. Elegant and powerful with great depth.

2002.description: September floods devastated the harvest. Difficult year.

2003.description: Heat wave vintage. Very ripe powerful wines, some lacking freshness.

2004.description: Good consistent vintage. Fresh balanced wines.

2005.description: Superb vintage. Perfectly ripe Grenache with dark fruit and spice.

2006.description: Very good warm vintage. Generous wines.

2007.description: Exceptional vintage. Concentrated balanced wines with extraordinary complexity.

2008.description: Cool uneven vintage. Some good wines from top estates.

2009.description: Warm generous vintage. Rich full wines.

2010.description: Legendary vintage. Perfect conditions produced monumental wines of extraordinary concentration and balance.

2011.description: Warm early vintage. Forward drinking wines.

2012.description: Strong vintage with good concentration and structure.

2013.description: Cool vintage. Lighter elegant style.

2014.description: Good balanced vintage with moderate concentration.

2015.description: Warm concentrated vintage. Rich powerful wines.

2016.description: Exceptional vintage. Concentrated complex wines with extraordinary balance.

2017.description: Hot dry vintage. Powerful wines with ripe fruit.

2018.description: Very warm vintage producing generous rich wines.

2019.description: Outstanding vintage. Perfect Grenache with depth, complexity and freshness.

2020.description: Warm dry vintage. Concentrated intense wines.

2021.description: Cooler vintage with lighter fresh wines.

2022.description: Hot summer but overnight cool preserved acidity. Good concentration.

2023.description: Variable season. Good quality from best estates.

1970.description: Good vintage with solid Barolo. Well-structured wines.

1971.description: Outstanding vintage for Barolo. Powerful concentrated wines built for decades.

1972.description: Cold wet year. Very poor Nebbiolo.

1975.description: Difficult year with rain and hail.

1978.description: Exceptional vintage. Warm dry conditions produced powerful long-lived Barolo.

1982.description: Very warm vintage producing rich powerful Barolo.

1983.description: Mixed vintage with some good wines.

1984.description: Cold and wet. Very difficult for Nebbiolo.

1985.description: Superb vintage. Warm conditions produced structured elegant wines.

1986.description: Good vintage overshadowed by 1985.

1987.description: Cool late vintage. Light wines.

1988.description: Very good vintage with excellent structure and depth.

1989.description: Exceptional vintage. Warm balanced conditions produced magnificent Barolo.

1990.description: Hot vintage. Rich powerful wines, though some lack the finesse of 1989.

1991.description: Hailstorms reduced quality in some areas. Uneven.

1992.description: Rainy vintage. Weak dilute wines.

1993.description: Decent vintage after two difficult years.

1994.description: September rains hurt quality. Some decent wines.

1995.description: Strong vintage with good concentration and structure.

1996.description: Classic vintage. Ideal growing conditions produced structured complex Barolo.

1997.description: Warm early vintage. Rich opulent wines with sweet fruit.

1998.description: Good vintage with firm structure. Classic Barolo.

1999.description: Excellent vintage. Powerful concentrated wines.

2000.description: Very good vintage. Balanced ripe wines.

2001.description: Outstanding vintage. Perfect balance of power and elegance.

2002.description: Hail and rain devastated many vineyards. Weak vintage.

2003.description: Extreme heat. Atypical wines, some good from high altitude.

2004.description: Classic vintage with excellent structure and finesse.

2005.description: Good vintage with balanced wines. Not as exciting as 2004.

2006.description: Excellent vintage. Powerful structured wines with great aging potential.

2007.description: Good warm vintage. Forward drinking style.

2008.description: Classic cool-climate vintage. Elegant structured wines.

2009.description: Warm vintage with some hail damage. Uneven.

2010.description: Exceptional vintage. Cool conditions produced Barolo of extraordinary elegance and complexity.

2011.description: Warm vintage with good fruit. Medium-term wines.

2012.description: Dry growing season. Concentrated firm wines.

2013.description: Outstanding vintage. Classic Nebbiolo with perfect balance and structure.

2014.description: Wet year. Some good wines from careful selection.

2015.description: Warm vintage with rich concentrated wines.

2016.description: Magnificent vintage. Perfect conditions produced Barolo of exceptional depth and finesse.

2017.description: Hot dry vintage. Powerful wines, some lacking freshness.

2018.description: Good balanced vintage after some September rain.

2019.description: Excellent vintage with warm balanced growing season. Complex wines.

2020.description: Warm vintage with good concentration. Solid quality across the board.

2021.description: Cooler vintage producing elegant lighter wines.

2022.description: Hot dry summer but good quality from best producers.

2023.description: Variable conditions. Decent quality overall.

1970.description: Good vintage for Brunello with structured tannic wines.

1971.description: Very good vintage. Classic Brunello with good aging potential.

1972.description: Wet cold vintage. Poor quality Sangiovese.

1977.description: Decent year with some good Chianti Classico.

1982.description: Very warm vintage. Rich concentrated Sangiovese.

1984.description: Cold wet year. No Brunello Riserva declared.

1985.description: Exceptional vintage. Warm conditions produced magnificent Brunello.

1986.description: Decent but overshadowed by 1985.

1987.description: Cool difficult year.

1988.description: Excellent vintage with structured classic wines.

1989.description: Mixed vintage. Some good wines from top estates.

1990.description: Outstanding vintage. Perfect Sangiovese with concentration and elegance.

1991.description: Good vintage overshadowed by 1990.

1992.description: Rainy harvest. Weak dilute wines.

1993.description: Good recovery year with solid wines.

1994.description: September rains reduced quality.

1995.description: Very good vintage with concentrated structured wines.

1996.description: Classic vintage with good acidity and structure.

1997.description: Warm excellent vintage. Rich complex Brunello and outstanding Super Tuscans.

1998.description: Decent vintage with balanced wines.

1999.description: Very good vintage with excellent Brunello.

2000.description: Warm vintage with rich forward wines.

2001.description: Excellent balanced vintage. Classic Tuscan elegance.

2002.description: Terrible weather with devastating September rains.

2003.description: Extreme heat. Atypical heavy wines lacking freshness.

2004.description: Superb vintage. Classic Sangiovese with perfect balance.

2005.description: Decent vintage but inconsistent.

2006.description: Outstanding vintage. Perfect ripeness with fresh acidity. Exceptional Brunello.

2007.description: Very warm vintage producing powerful rich wines.

2008.description: Good classic vintage with balanced wines.

2009.description: Good vintage, some heat stress.

2010.description: Exceptional vintage. Cool conditions produced Brunello of extraordinary elegance and structure.

2011.description: Warm vintage. Some good wines from higher elevations.

2012.description: Warm dry vintage. Concentrated balanced wines.

2013.description: Classic vintage with fresh elegant Sangiovese.

2014.description: Wet cool year. Challenging for Sangiovese.

2015.description: Superb vintage. Warm dry conditions produced magnificent Brunello.

2016.description: Exceptional vintage with perfect growing conditions. Elegant complex wines.

2017.description: Very hot dry vintage. Some wines lack freshness.

2018.description: Good vintage with balanced wines.

2019.description: Excellent vintage. Beautiful Sangiovese with depth and freshness.

2020.description: Warm vintage with good quality across Tuscany.

2021.description: Cooler vintage. Elegant lighter-bodied wines.

2022.description: Hot dry summer but good quality from careful producers.

2023.description: Variable season. Decent Sangiovese quality.
